title: Art + History: Asia in the World
hero_caption: Takamura Koun. One of a Pair of Ramma (Transom) Panels from the Hooden, 1893. Gift of the University of Illinois at Chicago.
short_description:
Learn more about the expansive history, diversity, geography, and enduring influence of Asia throughout the world in this workshop for educators. Participate in an inquiry-based lesson that explores the history of US-Japan relations in Chicago through a set of carved wooden transom panels created for the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition. Debrief with peers and access additional resources from our Asia in the World series. 

Please note that this program will take place via Zoom. If you have any questions about using Zoom or would like to let us know about any access needs, please email us at erc@artic.edu.
